text: so the most effective method of
contraception is the one that doesn't
rely on you first off I don't think
there's any one method of birth control
that's perfect for each woman so the
IUDs are implanted device so they're
placed by a healthcare provider they're
99.9% effective and most of the reason
why it's so effective is because it
doesn't rely on the user to do anything
you don't have to remember to take it
there's no maintenance so it is actually
the most effective form of contraception
that category of contraceptives are
called long-acting reversible
contraceptives and that's the reason why
they're discussed so much in the press
because birth control pills are probably
used by the most number of women in the
United States so most people do use a
daily oral birth control method the
issue is that it does rely on what we
call typical use so it relies on you as
the user to take it every day at roughly
the same time every day to make it
maximally effective which is 99.9%
effective so what the studies have shown
is that most women lead busy lives and
so the typical use is not as successful
as that 99.9% so it's more like 85%
effective and typical use because people
will forget it
you won't take at the same time of day
maybe you'll go on vacation and forget
to take it so the typical use with the
oral contraceptive pill is not quite as
effective as something like an IUD
